page.title: 12HOUSING IN SEAMILL
page.content: The majority of houses in Seamill are situated in picturesque spots. In{1896}there were only four houses on Portencross Road which are still there today.The scenery around these houses was glorious green fields but now the scenery is mostly houses. However it is still a very picturesque community. The only other building which was in the area in 1896 was the{Paisley {Home.}This was built in 1885, extended in 1894 and is now known as the {Community Centre.}Another interesting building is known as the{Fort,}as it is built on the site of an Iron Age fort. At the time of writing it is up for sale. There is also a dried up {duck pond}with an old house beside it. This is possibly going to be used for private housing development.
